abstract_summ: In the wake of the current COVID-19 pandemic, nutrition care that focuses on food security is imperative.The COVID-19 epidemic in Italy has shown many shortcomings of the national health care system but it also represents a historic opportunity to reinforce the central health care governance and reduce inequalities across the countryThose who survive this will need a lot of physical and mental rehabilitation, finds Clare WilsonAs the COVID-19 pandemic sweeps through the world, we must reassess the principles that guide our individual and collective responses and the way we operate in society.Covid-19 is rapidly spreading around the world during a period when many healthcare systems are already under pressure, reports Debora MacKenzieSome people with covid-19 need ventilation.The COVID-19 pandemic has changed the Australian medical landscape, especially in relation to how we need to provide clinical care in general practice.
title_summ: How well prepared are we?What comes after the ICU?On being human in the face of a pandemicThe Role of Medical Students During the COVID-19 PandemicWho will get ventilators in a covid-19 crisis?SurgealousyCOVID-19 from the land “Down Under” in an upside-down world:an Australian perspectiveCOVID-19 in Italy - Passing through bitter watersWhat information can I share with my patients about nutrition during COVID-19?Telehealth: Synopsis.
title_abstract_phrases: The Role of Medical Students During the COVID-19 PandemicIn this commentary, the authors discuss multiple potential clinical roles for medical students during the coronavirus disease 2019 pandemic.What information can I share with my patients about nutrition during COVID-19?In the wake of the current COVID-19 pandemic, nutrition care that focuses on food security is imperative.Those who survive this will need a lot of physical and mental rehabilitation, finds Clare WilsonOn being human in the face of a pandemicAs the COVID-19 pandemic sweeps through the world, we must reassess the principles that guide our individual and collective responses and the way we operate in society.COVID-19 in Italy - Passing through bitter watersThe COVID-19 epidemic in Italy has shown many shortcomings of the national health care system but it also represents a historic opportunity to reinforce the central health care governance and reduce inequalities across the countryThe COVID-19 pandemic has changed the Australian medical landscape, especially in relation to how we need to provide clinical care in general practice.
